title: Exponents with Negatives
text: When doing a problem in the form $$-\left(x^y\right)$$, where $$x$$ and $$y$$ are some numbers, this is really saying $$-\left(x^y\right)$$
speech: When doing a problem in the form  minus parentheses x to the y-th  , where  x  and  y  are some numbers, this is really saying , negative parentheses x to the y-th

title: Multiplying Negative Numbers
text: When multiplying two numbers, you can multiply as if they are both positive, then make the answer negative IF the signs of both numbers are different (ONLY ONE of the numbers is negative)
speech: When multiplying two numbers, you can multiply as if they are both positive, then make the answer negative IF the signs of both numbers are different (ONLY ONE of the numbers is negative)

title: Negative
text: Don't forget the negative in the original problem, which says that your final answer should be negative!
speech: Don't forget the negative in the original problem, which says that your final answer should be negative!
